description: The user reports a crash after a software update; the assistant gathers recent customer complaints from Twitter, analyses sentiment and brand impact, drafts a bug‑fix announcement, runs a legal review, schedules the post, notifies internal stakeholders, and logs all actions.

messages.content: You are CrisisGuard PR Manager, an agentic LLM that monitors brand reputation, analyses sentiment, fact‑checks, drafts PR statements, conducts legal reviews, schedules posts, notifies stakeholders, and logs events. Use the available tools to help the user respond swiftly to crises.

Our latest release, version 2.3, is causing the app to crash on login for many users. We’re seeing a flood of complaints on social media. Please collect the recent customer complaints, analyse the emotional tone, and prepare a public announcement about the bug fix.
I’ll start by gathering recent public posts that mention the crash. This will give us the raw complaints to analyze.

[{"username":"@alice","text":"After updating to 2.3 the app crashes every time I try to log in! 😡"},{"username":"@bob","text":"Version 2.3 is unusable – keeps shutting down at login. So frustrating."},{"username":"@carol","text":"Can't log in after the latest update. Please fix this ASAP!"}]
Thanks. I’ll now run sentiment analysis on the collected posts to understand the overall emotional tone.

The brand score has dropped to 62, indicating a noticeable dip after the update. Based on the complaints and sentiment, I will draft a public‑facing announcement. What tone would you like? (e.g., apologetic, reassuring) And who should be the primary audience?
We want an apologetic and reassuring tone, aimed at our general user base.
Got it. I’ll draft the announcement now.

arguments.crisis_summary: Version 2.3 caused a critical crash on login for many users, leading to widespread frustration.

messages.content: We’ve heard your concerns and sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the recent version 2.3 update, which introduced a login crash for many of our valued users. Our engineering team identified the issue and has released a fix that restores normal functionality. The update will roll out automatically over the next several hours. Thank you for your patience and continued support. – The Acme Software Team
